txt.en: 'Not so smart now, are you, [placeholder]?'
'I might have known you'd fall into the same crowd as your brother, Thomas!'
'I've had enough of this! Now you're going to pay, [placeholder]!'
'You're a no-good sneak, [placeholder], and we'll make you regret it!'
'Get in here, boys!'
'Cuthbert Sprunt isn't here yet, [placeholder], so there's still time to change your mind. Sprunt is a dangerous foe, but you shouldn't have any trouble...assuming he plays fair.'

'I knew that Sprunt planned on cheating, I just knew it! It's a good thing I was here, [placeholder], but all's well that ends well, I always say. Or at least, I'm saying it now!\n\n'Let me know when you're ready to return. We taught this villain a lesson, that much is certain, and I daresay his cronies won't be causing you any more trouble.'
'Ready to go? I certainly am. This was some good exercise, though, and I'm glad we've both come through it all right!'
Both you and Basil have not survived Sprunt's treachery
You and Basil have both survived Sprunt's treachery
'Ah, here he comes.'
'You all right, [placeholder]? Looks like we taught Sprunt a thing or two after all!'
'[placeholder] has decided to teach you a lesson, Sprunt.'
'Single combat.'
'Are you ready, [placeholder]?'
Cuthbert Sprunt has placed a bounty on your head, and you have decided to challenge him to single combat to have it removed.
'Archers, on the walls above us!'
'You're a long way from the Sea, fool! What good are you on land?'
Talk to Basil Gummidge
Defeat Cuthbert Sprunt
Defeat Cuthbert Sprunt
You and Basil must survive Sprunt's treachery
Talk to Basil Gummidge
'Are you going to turn into a bear now? Oooooh, I'm so scared!'
'Will you face us, or hide behind your shield like a base coward, [placeholder]?'
Basil Gummidge has travelled with you to the Sparring Circle of Ost Forod.\n\nBasil Gummidge is waiting to speak with you inside the Sparring Circle.
'Need to catch... my breath...'
You are engaged in single combat with Cuthbert Sprunt in the Sparring Circle.\n\nBasil Gummidge is overseeing the combat to ensure that Cuthbert does not cheat.
Cuthbert Sprunt has revealed his true colours and has called upon his cronies for aid.\n\nBasil Gummidge has leapt to your defence, and with his aid, you must defeat the enemy.
Basil Gummidge is in the Sparring Circle of Ost Forod.\n\nYou and Basil Gummidge have successfully overcome Cuthbert Sprunt's treachery. You should speak with Basil at once.
'Who would follow you, [placeholder]? You're not much of a captain!'
Basil Gummidge is in the Sparring Circle of Ost Forod.\n\nYou and Basil Gummidge have successfully overcome Cuthbert Sprunt's treachery.
'My brother was a better champion than you'll ever be! You're a coward!'
'It's Will Tripper, as much a scoundrel as his brother!'
'Sprunt, you villain! I always knew you for a cheating coward!'
'I'm with you, [placeholder]!'
'You're going to use only your fists? Ha! Don't make me laugh!'
'Good luck, [placeholder]! I'm cheering for you!'
'What are you doing here, Gummidge?'
'Fight on, [placeholder]! Do not give up, for I stand with you!'
'Single combat? That's rich!'
'Yeah, yeah, you're tough, all right. Would want you for my band if you weren't such a stickler for \qproper!\q'
'Don't feel like singing now, do you, [placeholder]?'
'I'm ready, you worthless [placeholder].'
'I'll shape up from now on! My villainous ways are behind me!'
'I'm through with villainy! You won't be seeing me again, I assure you!'
'I'm done with this band, you'll see! I'm leaving my villainy behind me!'
'Sorry, boss! This [placeholder] is too tough!'
'The [placeholder] looks ready enough to me!'
'You win! You win!'
'Thomas Idden and Graham Hinchcliffe! What treachery is this?'
'It's over, boss! We're finished!'
Instance: The Bounty-hunter
'[placeholder] is tougher than I thought!'
'I don't want to see any dirty tricks, Sprunt!'
'A better hunter might have seen this coming, [placeholder]!'
